name: Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: As usual with Four Seasons, the service was amazing. From the front door to the guys and gals at the pool and beach, the waitstaff at the restaurants and the housekeepers, the service was friendly and so very helpful. Best of all, they seemed to enjoy their jobs. I booked the least expensive room (Mountainview) for my family of four and we were upgraded to a room with a garden and partial ocean view room. It was perfectly roomy for 4 as was the marble bathroom. The balcony was also a good size. There were plenty of complimentary amenities and activiities - L'Occitane toiletries, bottled water, coffee and tea, computers, game room, dvd movies, excercise classes, snorkel equipment for one hour, hawaiian paddling. The restaurants served wonderful food and all served fixed price dinners which were embarassingly reasonable for the quality of the food and service. The beach in front of the hotel is one of the nicest on the entire island. As one previous reviewer stated, if you can at all swing the price, stay here. It is an experience you won't forget or regret. Kaanapali is a zoo, Kapalua is too remote with not much going on. Wailea is the place to stay in Maui, particularly the Four Seasons.
reviews.title: You won't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel, the staff was on top of every request, the grounds were beautiful, and the pool was one of the most relaxing i've been to. I have heard rumors they have am adult pool since our visit, so it looks like its time to go back!
reviews.title: Amazing location, service, all around hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Maui on June 8th, 2010. Upon our arrival, we learned that western Maui was in the midst of the worst brush fire in the island's history. As a result, all roads to western Maui where we were supposed to stay were blocked. We then contacted the Four Seasons Resort Maui at Wailea. Fortunately, they had room for us. From the first moment we arrived, we knew this was a top notch property. From the bell staff, to the front desk where we were greeted with tea and lavender scented warm hand towels, everyone was beyond friendly and very service oriented. We happened to have an executive suite that was incredible, but we suspect all rooms are of high quality. The friendliness and great service also included to the pool and beach staff. The property sits on a beautiful beach with very nice water. It is truly a five star property in all aspects. It is one of the best resorts I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: This is a first class resort with first class service and amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wouldn't have stayed here but the event we were going to landed at this property. Not saying that the hotel isn't gorgeous, it is. Service was terrific in all facets. Even had a high profile celebrity playing in the swimming pool (Adam Sandler). But jeez, $500 a night for a basic room? Oh yeah, it had a view of the ocean (you know the type....if you stand on the far edge of the room, tilt your head 45 degrees on your tippy toes, you can see a corner of the ocean). Breakfast was something like $40 per person, a pizza lunch for two came in around $70, and don't get me started about dinners here. I enjoy luxury just as much as the next person, but if its about $700 a day for a room and meals, there's something wrong with this picture. We stayed at the Hotel Wailea also, which admittedly isn't on the water (but the ocean view was much better), was quieter, roomier for something like $300 per night (breakfast and wine reception are free). Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, as long as his annual income exceeds $1M a year and doesn't have kids to put thru college.
reviews.title: If you can't afford it, don't stay there....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.Select the habour view room for your stay, if no other noisy happen, the room is perfect for people who love peace..The ocean front room has better view but a little bit nosiy out out the window because of the poolside activity.
reviews.title: One of the most luxury sesort you should never miss in maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned today from three fantastic days at this resort. We had an Ocean View Prime room that was beyond our expectations. The room was very big, well appointed and comfortable. The lanai (sp) was probably my favorite part. We were on the sixth floor with an incredible view of the beach and West Maui mountains. The lanai is very big with nice comfortable chairs. It's a great place to have room service, which we did for breakfast all three mornings. The room service came on time, and was hot and prepared EXACTLY as we requested. When you see other reviews talk about paying attention to small details, they do, such as how do you want your toast, lightly toasted, medium or dark. I've traveled quite a bit and never had that question asked before. The staff as mentioned in other reviews is the most friendly I've ever encountered, anywhere. They really do go out of their way to make you feel special. I asked the room service waiter about occupancy and he said they were at 93%, even so you really couldn't tell.
reviews.title: Turn this plane around, I want to go back!
Four Seasons in Maui = Hotel and Service in a class by itself!
reviews.text: Yes this place is expensive, but I definately feel it is worth it. Our room ran about $800 each night, but again I feel we received a good value. This was our first Four Seasons experience and I definately did not want it to be our last.

reviews.title: If you are going to Maui, this is the place
reviews.text: The pool is very small, but still really nice. It was bathwater warm, which is how I like it, we also stayed at the Hilton Waikoloa Village and their pools while awesome were icewater cold, so it doesn't matter how nice the pool is if you can't get in it.

reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.text: The only restaurant we ate at was Ferraro's and it was very good. The view is hard to beat with the beach, sunset, whales, it really doesn't get better than that. One thing we struggled with was meal time, after five or six days in Hawaii every meal is so huge and extraordinary we were looking for something more simple. Even though it wasn't on the menu at Ferraro's I asked for a simple order of Spaghetti and the server was so awesome to recommend it before I even asked! I guess she caught onto some of my questions about the menu items, anyway they were so great to accomodate a special request. Our other meals were eaten at Tommy Bahama's in the Shops at Wailea and also Outback Steakhouse, again just looking for something more ordinary, and both of those were very good.

reviews.title: Truly wonderful staff and hotel
reviews.text: The beach is great and again the service, coming around with cool towels, ice water, fresh fruit, it's the little things and they do them very well. These people are there to serve and they are proud to do it. The walking path infront of the resort is an amazing walk, very beautiful if you go left out of the resort away from the Grand Wailea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: I just read the review from the honeymoon couple I agree. We stayed at Four Seasons the last week of March. We have kids 12 and 9 and we were totally surprised by the behavior of children at the pool and the lack of parents or nannies watching their kids. The pool was so rough and loud we went to the beach most everyday .The hotel staff needs to take back control of pool and stop pushing and fighting in pool. When many of us complained not much was done. Lots of complaining by many how horrible pool situation was. The fight for pool chairs at this resort the worst I've ever seen. Many up at 6am staking out their chairs and then not using them, silly.
reviews.title: Surprised this hotel is rated number one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Now, what we loved the giant suite we were upgraded to very spacious. The hotel definitely needs renovated the hotel is very worn and smells like mildew. Some new carpets would really help. Balconies have beautiful views, but everyone in the hotel is overlooking each other, I got tired of listening to peoples cell phone calls on balcony, they can be heard word for word.
reviews.title: No worries . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Food at pool great. Book reservations early we could not eat at hotel restaurants many nights. Ferraros closes with rain. The best restaurants we found were Stella Blues and Fred's Mexican. Both reasonable fun and great food.
reviews.title: Honeymooners beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: The concierges at hotel were fabulous and very helpful with everything. Beach service
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: was terrific and very friendly attendants unlike pool. We always tipped generously at beach and pool's saw many who didn't and they still got great service. Pool attendants not as friendly or helpful as beach. Maybe you have to be a regular each year but I expected better at pool. Pools as you read are way to tiny and dirty for this type of hotel. Not sure if my expectations were to high and that's why I felt disappointed but not as great as expected. We were just as pampered last year in Riviera Maya for half the price. Another good thing is great snorkeling right off shore. Loved our trip but felt people should be warned Four Seasons might not be the number one hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: Fantastic
another great trip
reviews.text: still excellant hotel and property with some of the best staff of all their resorts.

reviews.title: Probably the best resort we've ever stayed in
reviews.text: would be nice if they could have an adult pool area with lap pools. the second newer pool they built never has any places to sit unless you want to spend $500 a day for a cabana.

reviews.title: Celebration dinner
reviews.text: the therapists at the spa are great but the spa needs to be upgraded especially given the prices they charge for a treatment. Spago probably has the best food on Maui.

reviews.title: Superb!
reviews.text: This is a wonderful property that sets an incredibly high bar for what a luxury beach vacation should be. Having stayed at a number of excellent hotels (including several Four Seasons) this was by far our favorite. The reason is that they did so many little things well. The concierge desk delieverd an enormous bouqet of flowers for my wife with less than an hour's notice. The valet service is top notch -- my car was often greeted by two people at a time and always stocked with water a towels. The property is spotless -- again, even relatively to other luxury resorts in Maui and elsewhere. Even the smallest rooms (which we reserved) are large and well appointed. The buffet breakfast is outstanding (...I can't tell you how many $40 or 50 breakfasts I've had a hotels that are thoroughly average). Now, if you're looking for a remote vacation experience (a la Fiji) this is not that -- it's still in Wailea and very family oriented. Otherwise, I can't imagine a better hotel choice.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, some faults need to be improved, worth visiting
reviews.text: Our family met here for dinner while we were in Maui. There were 10 of us. The service was impeccable! The staff were efficient, friendly and advised of all the specials. We loved everything that was served! It was so good we ate there again before we left the Island. Do eat there you will not be disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Just returned from a 10 night stay at the FS Maui with my wife and two children (3 years and 9 months) and had an incredible time. There is little doubt that this place is expensive but you get what you pay for and this was as close to a perfect vacation as one can get. Although I have stayed at other FS properties with my children before, I was a little nervous that we would be out of place and feel somewhat unwelcomed. This could not be further from the case. The hotel is the most kid-friendly hotel we have ever stayed at and I can highly recommend it to families with children of all ages. We stayed in a garden view executive suite which was huge. The room had a nice entrace foyer, a large living room with a dining area, pull out sofa, minibar, amoire with a TV/DVD/VCR in it and access to the lanai. The bedroom was separated from the living room by doors and had a king bed, chair, amoire with another TV and DVD player and access the the lanai. The bathroom was enormous--even by FS standards. The hotel was opened in 1990 and I do not think the rooms have been renovated since the opening. Notwithstanding this, we found the rooms to be tastefully decorated and in very good shape. The toiletries are L'Occitaine and are quite nice. We had the B&B package which meant that we had breakfast buffet included in the rate. The buffet is huge and offers just about anything one could want. The children ate free which was nice and the hotel provided plastic plates, bowls and cups, paper and crayons, and building toys. (The children also at free at night in the Pacific Terrace Restaurant since they were under 5 which was also a nice touch) The pool area, as mentioned by some, is small but we found it more than adequate--the kids pool is great--perfect for our aged of children. The poolside service is out of this world. Every morning we would hit the pool by 8:30, pick a cabana and it was set up with towels, chair covers, ice water and a crib for our baby. Last year we stayed at the Kea Lani and they charged for cabanas--it is nice that that the FS includes them at no cost as it allowed us to remain poolside all day. The beach is great--much better than Polo Beach--and the beach service is as good as the pool service--they even rake the beach every morning! The hotel provides water and beach toys as well so there is no need to bring them from home. The poolside staff are incredible and we really enjoyed the amenities they provided. They were, without exception, friendly and really made the trip enjoyable. Since our son is not yet 5, he could not attend the Kids For All Seasons programs without an adult but we were welcome to join them in all of their activities. Our son had a blast at all the activities we attended and did not want to the leave. The staff were, as with the rest of the hotel, excellent. The food at the hotel was quite good although the poolside menu gets a little old after 10 days. Ferraro's was o.k.-probably not worth it except for the views. Spago was excellent and the Pacific Terrace Restaurant was quite good. We had room service on one occassion and it was delivered in a timely manner and was quite good. The game room in the hotel is great with shuffleboard, pool tables, fooseball, ping pong and sony playstations and the cardio area is great. We really enjoyed the other guests and, with only a few exceptions, found them to be quite friendly and down to earth. We had some fun celebrity sights while we were there as Britney Spears, John Stamos and Mick Fleetwood were all staying at the resort at various times during our stay. The valets always had the car waiting for us and were quick to offer directions and bottled water. Having stayed at the Kea Lani, the Ritz Carlton and the Westin, there is little doubt in my mind that this is the best place to stay in Wailea, Kaanapali or Kapaula and, in the end, well worth it. One word of caution however, there is a lot of construction going on right across the street from the Grand Waliea (which is next door to the FS) and we could definitley hear the beeping from trucks backing up from our room (we were on the ground floor of the north tower). Although not terribly distracting as we were out of the room most of the day, I would suggest asking for a room in the south tower if avaialble and also avoid the mountainside rooms until the construction is complete--which, by the looks of things, could be quite a while. We did not notice the construction noise in any of the public areas of the hotel nor did we hear anyone complaining about it.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
okay, but not as great as everyone says it is
reviews.text: Ok, so its a nice hotel on a nice beach. The restaurants as some people have said are rip off expensive. My wife and I had 2 sandwiches, a bottle of evian (upsold very well by the waitress) and 2 mango margaritas(also well upsold). $85.00 before the tip.

reviews.title: A 3 star hotel billed as 5 star
reviews.text: The rooms are nice enough, we had a partial ocean view. Housekeeping visits twice as others have mentioned. The maintenance of the buildings is ok, but hallway carpets are dirty and showing wear. Watch out for the valet parking. Its $12 if you keep your car overnight. Add $5 for a tip and it gets expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: The staff was friendly, not a 5 star hotel at least in my mind though. It just wasn't that great. Guests there when we went were pretty snooty, not even acknowleging our presence, even in the elevator. The pool is pretty sad, very small and not something your really going to spend time in. Beach was better, snorkeling outside of the hotel was outstanding.
reviews.title: A terrific resort worth every penny!
February 4-11, 2006
reviews.text: All in all I was very disappointed, especially for the total dollar value. The Grand Weilea next door seemed alot more fun. If you have to stay there, bring your booze and food from the grocery store...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still one of the best and finest hotels in the world, with overall outstanding service!
reviews.title: Can it get any better than this?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Though next time, I'll try to come during weekdays in off season as peak season takes away from some of their otherwise excellent service.
reviews.title: Another Fabulous Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: For example, a few things I noticed during this trip:
reviews.title: Beautiful paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Check in guy did not smile (although literally every other Four Seasons staff member we encountered has always been very welcoming, warm and open).
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Lunch was messed up twice. First day on our arrival, it was so busy we had to move from the infinity pool to the downstairs pool for lunch as no beds had become available between 10.30 AM until 3 PM. Downstairs, after receiving the menu, it still took 45 (!) minutes to order despite asking for the waiter twice. Moreover, the order wasn't taken in correctly (we received 1 main course and 1 appetizer instead of 2 main courses and 1 appetizer). This was very untypical Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, amazing service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Four Seasons Maui is a beautiful resort in the best part of Maui. We spent our days swimming in the pool and playing in the ocean. And when our 6-year-old daughter tired of swimming in the afternoon, she enjoyed the daily movie-time at Kids for All Seasons. The pool itself was nothing special, but I would not trade our stay at the Four Seasons for the "better" pools at nearby resorts. I can't wait to return next summer!
reviews.title: Best vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 word PARADISE !!! We heard many great things about Four Seasons Maui and they have exceeded our expectations and more... The staff was unbelievable the people were unbelievable the common areas were unbelievable... If you are going to Maui DO NOT HESITATE!!!!!!
reviews.title: GREATEST EXPERIENCE OF OUR LIFE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a great option. My husband and I stayed in August for our baby moon (last vacation pre baby). It's a fantastic hotel with great amenities. One thing to note is, if travelling without kids, there is an adults only serenity pool. Seats are first come first serve- so you have to get in line by 6:30-6:45 to get a spot. Very much worth getting up to do. They will hold your chairs for you for an hr, so after getting a spot you can enjoy a leisurely breakfast. Most will complain about the food cost, but I don't know what else you'd expect at a Flur Seasons! Great service, great staff, great rooms, great amenities. Will visit again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Four Seasons from July 10- July 14th and got married on the beach not far from the hotel. It was simply gorgeous. We had the most amazing dinner at Spago with excellent food and service. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. We were upgraded to a larger for the second night on. It was a very memorable experience and lived up to every expectation. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience, Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's probably the easy option, just going for the best reviewed hotel, but really don't you want the best for your trip? There's a time and place for the modest hotel but when you're in Maui, splurge and stay here at the Four Seasons. Great setting for couples and families too. In fact, the little touches like bringing freezies to the "kids" in the pool was a hit for all. Attention to detail is bang on.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday setting...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Four Seasons was as a guest for a destination wedding. The Four Seasons is the best hotel on the Island and we were treated to an outstanding experience every day. Recognition by name from most of the staff, and excellent service especially at the Serenity Pool (but you have to go up early, 7:00 am to reserve chairs and you cannot leave them for an hour without giving them up). A spectacular setting for a Wedding to be remembered!!! We loved the breakfasts every morning in the cool Island breeze and views of the ocean though a little pricey!Sunsets every evening were amazing. Our photos don't do them justice!!! We ate most evening meals off site as we like to explore local color so can't say much about the restaurants, except Spago which was delicious but again very pricey! Would definitely return for another visit.
reviews.title: Beautiful Memories!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Resort Is beautiful and service is very good. Downsides .... Room reserved (double queen) was not available at check in. A bit of a hassle to relocate to the reserved room the next day. Cannot really unpack and settle in. Reservation was for 3 adults. You would think since you pay for the extra person, the hotel would acknowledge that by providing an extra robe, towels, water, etc. They seem to think in couples only. Food quality, though pricey as expected was very good. Service excellent at beach front and pool. Service at Spago somewhat bizarre. Up to five wait staff hovering around, but difficult to get their attention. Would not return to this resturant. Mahalo.
reviews.title: Very Good but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly one of the best hotels we ever stayed!!
reviews.title: heaven !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent staff, very welcoming and caring, amazing property and the position is magnificent !!
reviews.title: overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we took some breathtaking pictures of the beautiful sunsets in wailea....
reviews.title: First Class resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Jan08 for a week.
reviews.title: Four Seasons Four Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were greeted and given lei's made from leaves which I thought was very tasteful - not the typical orchids you see everywhere (which I still love!). Checkin was smooth and effortless.
reviews.title: Four Seasons Maui sets standard for 5 diamond hotel rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: Started out in a "Mountain side" room (not Mountain "View "room which we learned upon arrival). The view was so disappointing that we asked to change rooms to the next level - "Garden View" which the mgmt. graciously accommodated us at no charge. The view from the Garden View room was of the ocean and W. Maui mountains. Even though we were at the back of the "U" the view was stunning. Unless you don't care about your room, don't book the Mountain "Side" room. The interior of the room was elegantly furnished - large flat screen TV, desk, sofa, chair, dresser, large closet with safe, wet bar, fridge and Tassimo coffee maker (incl. coffee, tea, hot choc disks which were replenished daily). A welcome box of cookies and confections greeted us - very delicious.
reviews.title: The Best!!
Umm Paradise!!!!!
reviews.text: The bathroom was almost the size of the main living area, all marble, separate soaking tub, shower, double vanity and toilet closet. Robes and toiletries (l'Occitaine) were top notch. A choice of in room audio channels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Turndown service every night included an orchid on the pillow, printout of the next days events as well as slippers placed bedside and hawaiian music playing.
reviews.title: Treat you like a star

likes.liked: — Exceptional service in a beautiful setting
likes.disliked: — Hard to find something to complain about!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is one of the most beautiful hotels with 5 star service. Every staff member we encountered was top notch. Whatever our request was, they met it with a great attitude. From the valet, to the front desk, to the staff at the restaurants, to room service, to the great guys down at the beach, to the poolside staff....just an amazing vacation with our kids. We did not want to leave and cannot wait to go back! Thank you Four Seasons for a perfect vacation!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The are not enough superlatives to accurately describe our stay at this hotel. The staff are absolutely fabulous and obviously care about the vacation experience of their guests. To the excellent team at the dive shop (especially Mark, who was a brilliant guide for our snorkel safari and scooter snorkels) to concierge services, to front of house, to room keeping, to the restuarant staff and the outrigger canoe team, than you for making this the best hotel experience I have ever had.
reviews.title: Perfect from start to finish.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, it's not cheap, but it is worth every penny.
reviews.title: A fine place for a honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: The only drawback is that the resort is so good, you won't want to leave it to see the rest of maui.
reviews.title: Benchmark by which to judge everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: LST.
reviews.title: four seasons service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui the first week of March for our 20th anniversary. The resort is beautiful, but a bit smaller than I had expected. After 14 hours of travelling (from Pittsburgh, PA), we really appreciated the cool towels and lei greeting at check in. I was very happy when they told us that we had been upgraded to a prime ocean view room (on the 5th floor) when we checked in. I had booked a garden view room through our travel agent, but I called the hotel about 2 weeks before our arrival to request an upgrade and to let them know we were coming to Maui to celebrate our anniversary. When we got to the room, there was a chilled bottle of champagne along with a note wishing us a happy anniversary.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort
Maui - Paradise on Earth
reviews.text: The room itself was very large and well laid out, but the fabrics looked a little dated and faded to me. The bathroom was huge, with a double sink, plenty of counter space, and a separate glass-enclosed shower. The L'Occitane toiletries were fabulous. The best part of the room was the large lanai with a great view of the ocean on one side and the mountains on the other. I was really thankful that we receved an upgrade. The garden view rooms on the 3rd floor opened up directly onto the hotel grounds and didn't seem to have much privacy.

reviews.title: Prepare to be pampered and spoiled! Best Place We've Ever Stayed
reviews.text: The two pools were lovely, but not as large as those at other resorts (such as the Kea Lani, Grand Wailea, and Ritz Carlton). We were always able to find a lounge chair, though, and the service around the pool was wonderful. Attendants constantly refilled our water glasses, frequently offered us cool towels and evian spritzes, and periodically brought by cool pops and fresh fruit. Even though the Grand Wailea pool area was larger, it seemed more crowded because of the loud groups and large number of families. The pools at the Four Seasons were very tranquil and peaceful in comparison.

reviews.title: Unbelievably fantasic hotel!!!
reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant twice and lunch at Ferraro's once. The breakfast buffet was very good, but pricey ($26/person). It included an omelet station, fresh fruit, an assortment of juices, eggs, waffles/pancakes, meats, and breakfast pastries. My husband ordered pancakes from the menu, and on the first day the pancakes were large (nearly the size of the plate), but on the second day, they were very small (about 4 inches in diameter). Lunch at Ferraro's was just OK, but very expensive (over $50 for a hamburger, a small pizza, and two sodas).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: All in all, we had a wonderful anniversary trip and I'm glad we chose the Four Seasons over the Grand Wailea. The Grand Wailes might be a better choice for families, but the Four Seasons seems better suited for couples who want a peaceful, relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: Everything you would expect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at FS Maui four glorious nights (3/2 - 3/6). We were upgraded to a garden view from a mountain side upon check in (the hotel was not booked to capacity).
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect. The service, the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room and facility, water and complementary sun block stations everywhere, tasty drinks served poolside...I could go on and on!
reviews.title: Spectacular!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather held steady at about 82 degrees and cooled off nicely at night. We took the beach path to the right of the hotel and made our way down through some rocky terrain to where the ocean pushed through protruding rocks and made little pools near our feet. Just off these rocks is said to be some of the best snorkeling. Unfortunately, we didn't snorkel much but from this spot we saw little colorful fish being trapped in the pools, big black crabs running around and a turtle even popped it's head out of the water in front of us! We watched a mother and her baby whale(s) from here at dusk one night too.
reviews.title: One of the very best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The outrigger excursion is a must. The FS offers it as a complimentary service; all you have to do is sign up with (I recommend at least 24 hours before you want to go). We saw whales surfacing in the relatively close distance and saw some even jumping totally out of the water! Lots of tail action. The instructor told us that earlier that morning a pod of whales swam right under the canoe! We weren't as lucky, but just being out there is calming and serene.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a message at the spa and it was one of the best I had ever received! She gave me some pure aloe vera (not the green stuff!) for my sunburn to put on after I showered. Ahh. FS, we've been back two days and I miss you already!
reviews.title: Great Location, Service and Ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of five arrived at the Four Seasons after 4 days in Kaanapali. Upon checking out of our condo in Kaanapali we filled in time by driving to Twin Falls which is half way along the road to Hana. Quite a nice drive though not as amazing as I expected. Lunched at Mama's Fish House on the way back. Lovely atmosphere on a beautiful beach. Arrived at Four Seasons at check-in time to make the absolute most of our 3 days there. Were pleasantly surprised at our upgrade from POV to Ocean View. We were a little concerned at how we would all it in the room (after been spoilt in our beautiful spacious ocean front villa at Kaanapali Ali) but it proved to be large and very comfortable.
reviews.title: A Real Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed all the luxuries and great service at Four Seasons. Definitely the best choice in Wailea. Though our 14 year old son enjoyed the pools at Grand Wailea where friends were staying. Our 16 and 19 year old daughters loved sitting by the pool up on the grassy area which overlooked the beach. Found the adult pool a bit pretentious.
reviews.title: Honeymoon PERFECTION!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Snorkelling on Wailea beach was fantastic. Very clear with many colourful fish and turtles. Much better than Black Rock in Kaanapali and probably even better than Honolua Bay which was also pretty good. Even the tour boats stopped outside Four Seasons for snorkelling.
reviews.title: PARADISE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Yes, it is a very quiet area with not much to do but just make the most of the wonderful resort and relax for a few days. We had a car but only used it to drive to Wailea Hotel's restaurant Capishe. A lovely meal with great views at night. We also dined at Duo (had the $49 three course meal). It was pretty good but the service and atmosphere wasn't great. Probably should have dined at Spago. We also dined at Ferraro's which had a lovely night atmosphere on the beachfront. Average food though my gourmet 19 year old daughter said she had one of the best meals at this restaurant.
reviews.title: Pampered with high level of attention/service
Elegance & Perfection
reviews.text: Great games room with Billiards, Table tennis, etc and a separate video games room. We found the free internet service in the games room to be more than adequate for our purposes. Also free tea, coffee and newspapers each morning in the games room.

reviews.title: Greet hotel great island
reviews.text: Have been to this hotel multiple times and it is just a great place to go" the spago restr is excellent and location is perfect. Honestly, Everytime I come here I wonder why I sat in a plane for 22hrs to go to Asia when this is 6 hrs direct from phoenix. No need to go anywhere else and they have the best spa in the entire four seasons hotel group.

reviews.title: Maui's Gem of a Resort
reviews.text: Though larger than most newer Four Season's Resorts, the brand is well-served by a well designed, scaled and appointed lush resort. Beautiful gardens and very private feeling beach make for a truly special Hawaiian holiday. WIth several dining options including what easily could be the best Spago's in the chain, and a lobby bar that seems to be floating over gardens, the resort can only be described as a hotel chain at the top of its game. Incredibly welcoming staff and service make one long for a lengthier stay...

reviews.title: perfect holiday
reviews.text: My wife and i returned to the four seasons for the second time. This time we increased our stay to 9 days. Again the hotel is one of the best we have stayed at. We took a garden view room which was large with a great size bathroom. Our room was serviced twice a day we were given chocalte on arrival and cakes for the wifes birthday. ( nice extra touch)The service everywhere was great. It was peak time so alot of children were staying at the resort. This is where the serenity pool area was great for us. The staff up there are amazing, the views great and the pools and spas wonderful. One of the staff in particulair (Rowena) is a gem and the service and treats she spends the day giving you make the whole stay even better. From cold towls to ice creams and other treats things just keep coming. As knowone under 21 are allowed into the area it provides for couples who are holidaying without children. They dont make it obvious but for a cost you can book chairs for the day during busy periods. The private cabanas are even better and worth the money just for a treat. The cabanas around the general pool are also great and during off peak times provide a great spot with great views but during the peak times, too noisy and the kids took over the pool.The food was still good at the restaruants but they can try and rush you sometimes. Dont be afraid to slow them down and enjoy the views.

reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon
reviews.text: Overall great bed, great ammenities, great staff, great service, choice of pool areas, beach provides good swimming and snorkeling( sea turtles are plentiful)the best breakfast on maui in Duos( i recommend including breakfast in your package) live music in the lounge bar of an evening, i couldn't fault our stay there. Its at the high end but you get what you pay for. I highly recommend for couples.

reviews.title: Surprisingly--the most kid friendly resort I've ever been to!
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it was definitely the best part, which was mainly down to the hotel. When we got there we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us which was a lovely touch. We were also upgraded from a garden view room to a partial ocean view room. The room was great. Nothing was too much to ask from any of the staff. We ordered room service a couple of times which was always right on time. We were particularly impressed by the free car shuttle service which took you to where you wanted to go (within reason) and the drivers were very friendly. We were also very impressed by being treated like individuals. The serenity pool is great, if you don't manage to get in in the morning, then you can put your name down later and would normally get a seat later in the day. We enjoyed a delicious meal in the restaurant Spago, fantastic service again. Cannot fault this hotel, was pefect in every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for our honeymoon and it was simply a wonderful a experience. Wonderful service
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: from the attentive staff at the front desk, concierge, valet, and especially at the infinity pool. We rented the cabana at the pool and it was a nice treat. Definitely do it at least once. The food was expensive, but we anticipated that. We had an amazing time and cannot wait to go back again!
reviews.title: Perfection!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a fabulous stay at this property...and it was truly perfection.
reviews.title: Four Seasons Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The property is beautiful, impeccably stylish and perfectly maintained with courteous,
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel with great service comittment from all staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: friendly, and knowledgeable staff members. Once we checked in we were truly able to
reviews.title: Great place but ocean view is not ocean view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a reason why this particular hotel gets the best ratings and is one of the best hotels in North America. It's all to do with the excellent service that the staff provides for every guest that enters their property. No matter who you are, whether you are just having dinner or on your honeymoon, the staff are polite, helpful and always smile. It makes a world of difference when the service is this good.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "good" stuff:
reviews.title: Four Seasons Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The staff. Really, I can't stress this enough.
reviews.title: Amazing week in paradise!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The property grounds are always spotless, yet you don't ever see anyone cleaning or pruning the gardens.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Great pool service, clean pools, great cabanas, complimentary classes, children's toys and scuba diving taster.
reviews.title: Amazing Service, First Class Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a very frequent FS guest and can honestly tell you that I was a bit disappointed in this property.
reviews.title: Good but not nearly up to FS Standards
Maui Wowie
reviews.text: The property itself is stunning....great views, nice rooms, and very wonderful grounds. I was upgraded to a suite and the room was outstanding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having stayed at many FS resorts as well as many One and Only properties, I can say that this does not stand up to the O&O. The service was average, the food was not very good at all, and the pool was overcrowded and small. Everyone we talked to agreed that the food was very sub-par (no one we talked to loved their meals)
reviews.title: True American Paradise!!

likes.disliked: — The LONG walk to the elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am writing this review as a non-bias opinion. I was really hoping that this property lived up to the FS hype, but it honestly did not . Spago and Due were very poor. Lunch at the pool was very good. Rooms were outstanding and service was ok.
reviews.title: Four Season Maui...top of the line.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, I would chose the O&O over this property any day. The OO La Palmilla (Cabo) and the Ocean Club are far superior.
reviews.title: Enjoyed being pampered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Literally don't know where to start...my wife and I stayed here for the best week of our lives as part of our honeymoon in early May this year.
reviews.title: The greatest place in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were treated like Royalty, our room was upgraded and literally every member of staff couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't have enough adjectives to say what a fantastic hotel this is in a beautiful location
reviews.title: Best hotel we ever stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AMAZING!
reviews.title: The Four Seasons Maui no- ka oi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: So much has already been said that I feel like I don't have a lot to add, but I had to put in my two cents about how wonderful this place is. I hope when I get to heaven, it's half as nice as laying out by the infinity pool at the Four Seasons Maui! The service is second to none, the rooms are spacious, the food was delicious.
reviews.title: Not Up To Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have been going to Maui every year for over 15 years until four years ago and decided to take a break. I have stayed in all types of hotels and vacation rentals over that time from private beach houses, condos and resorts on both sides of the island including the Hyatt (which I still like) Sheraton, Kei Lani, Grand Wailea (horrible and last choice) and the Four Seasons. While this was not our first time visiting the Four Seasons I would have to say that based on experience this really is the best choice available and while not cheap at close to $1,000 a night you really do get what you pay for here. We booked a partial ocean view room on the club level. What I liked about this room, it faces the outside of the Resort towards Makena. The prime ocean view rooms on the club level face towards the pool area and the Grand Wailea (disneyland) next door and you also see the rooms across the courtyard. I'm at the pool all day or on the beach and see that view, so it was nice to face towards the Molikini crater to get a different look so I would say a booking tip here is not to pay for the prime ocean view rooms. Another nice option about the Four Seasons is you can fax a shopping list and have your in room frig. stocked with the items you want. This is not as important if your on the club level as they have food service four times a day and an open bar at all times, no cost and if you need anything you can just take it to your room, for example bottled water, chips, sandwiches and so on. The club level food service had a continental breakfast in the morning that varies every day with a combination of the usual items and a few new ones like french toast, egg fritata, eggs florentine as a few examples, mid day or afternoon tea as they call it was a mix of sandwiches, quiche, cheese, deserts and other finger foods. The happy hour also had a mix of the same items everyday and a few new hot and cold appetizers. The fourth service was around 8:30pm to ? which was all deserts and really, really good. With food service like this every day you don't need to go down for breakfast in the morning at $35 a person. Other items included on the club level are your own private staff to arrange day trips, rest resv's free use of the internet and business center on that level, use of binoculars to view any whales going by and many other perks.
reviews.title: Best Resort/Hotel on Maui with one big flaw

likes.disliked: — fight for a cabana, nothing a good tip won't fix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would say that as with all resorts at this level budget and bring some $$$ for tips, they go a long way. The beach staff, pool staff were great. The cabanas by the pool fill up fast. People were going to the pool a laying stuff out early, I mean early 6am. They have a policy that at 7am when the staff shows up you check in with them and regardless if there are items already out they will be removed and the cabanas and chairs given out, this is important as people would put stuff on chairs leave and come back hours later. I found it best to show up at 7am hand the attendant $40 get a cabana and be taken care of all day. Now if you think that sounds expensive I will tell you my friends were staying at Disneyland (Grand Wailea) next door and if you want to reserve a cabana there for the day it will cost you over $350
reviews.title: 3rd trip to FS Maui and I continue to be impressed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They really do bring you cold evian, frozen fruit and drinks. They will also stop by and detail your sunglasses for you. The beach has toys available for the children, cold water and both the beach and pool areas have free suntan lotion so don't bother buying and hauling lotion around with you, another tip.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

likes.disliked: — Pool side food and beverage service is very inconsistent

reviews.title: Great Hotel - Fix the Room Descriptions
reviews.text: The gym and cardio equipment were top quality and in great condition. The spa is really relaxing and the treatments were some of the best I have had. We had dinner at all three restaurants and were never let down by the service or food. At Duo they have mixologist and drink menu that is worth paying some attention to. Spago is great place for a meal and drink and another tip is to book Feraros for dinner at around 30 min before sunset. The restaurant is outdoors and overlooks the beach. In my opinion the three best restaurants on Maui are all located at the Four Seasons, Spago, Duo and Feraros.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were traveling with children and the perks were cribs, toys, diaper bin, changing supplies, strollers and many other items available at no charge.
reviews.title: Will NEVER be outdone!

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, incomparable luxury

reviews.title: Loved our stay but totally different than Manele Bay
reviews.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary in Hawaii. We came to the Four Seasons at Manele Bay and then continued on to the Four Seasons in Maui at Wailea. We took a ferry from Lana’i to Maui…that was a wonderful option suggested by the concierge at the Four Seasons at Manele Bay. I would really encourage guests to consider that option – much better than using Island Air and risking all the delays (which happened to us when we flew from Honolulu to Lana’i).

reviews.title: Paradise the Second Time Around
reviews.text: Compared to Manele Bay, the Four Seasons at Wailea is a TOTALLY different experience. First of all, the facilities are GORGEOUS and NEW. We had no mold or dampness problem here like we did at Manele Bay. The setting is breathtaking – like Manele – but not of the same caliber. Manele is in a class by itself when it comes to setting. The water is beautiful, the ocean bottom sandy, and the setting is lovely. Every day around noon the trade winds kick up and they can blow quite powerfully for the next several hours.

reviews.title: With some many excellent reports I was not disappointed
reviews.text: The major difference for us was that this hotel on Maui felt really crowded…there were people everywhere. It is a large property, with nearly 400 rooms, and is much more active and up-tempo. The staff was running, running, running, and therefore, did not have the time (or take the time) to stop and give you the level of personal service we had experienced at the other property. They tried hard – but it was such a different feel compared to Manele Bay. At Maui we did not feel like we received “personalized” service, at least at first. It might have been a culture shock because we were at Manele Bay first and then came to Maui. We did not have the opportunity to really talk with any of the staff – until we met Lyn, the waitress who served us breakfast for several days in their “Duo” restaurant. Lyn went out of her way to make our trip special. She had a special breakfast tray brought to us for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. On the day we left she packed us some special goodies for the airplane. She hugged us when we left. She was absolutely darling! She truly changed our feelings about the staff at Maui. THANK YOU LYN!

reviews.title: Pure Heaven!!!!
reviews.text: The Four Seasons at Maui offered many more things to do than at Manele. They posted a full schedule of activities, some complementary and some for fee, every morning. We took advantage of lots of them. My husband went golfing at Wailea’s Gold Course – and we did not think it compared to the Challenge at Manele. The course was “greener” but the did not have the breathtaking views of Manele nor were the holes as pleasing to play. Also, if possible bring your own clubs. Paying $75 to rent a set of decent clubs on top of hefty greens fees is really wringing the last dollar out of visitors.

reviews.title: If you have the money....
reviews.text: It would be a great location for our teenage sons if we have the opportunity to bring them back with us. The kid’s lounge is large and stocked with lots of activities (pool tables, video games, big TV, etc) to keep the occupied. The restaurants on the property were pricey, but get used to it – there are no cheap dining options in the Wailea section of Maui. I would l have liked to see a little café – like a Starbuck’s type option – for people who want a quick bite….that type of option was no where to be found.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family needed a break from the day to day business of our every day lives in Los Angeles. We decided to visit the Four Seasons Resort in Maui at the recommendation of friends. We were beyond thrilled with the friendliness of the staff, hotel amenities and, most important, the way our kids were treated. Our 5 year old twins can't stop talking about visiting Maui next year and our 16 year old had the time of her life. There is something for everyone at this hotel.
reviews.title: We Love The Four Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip was the perfect get away for a family that needed some regrouping time together. It helped us relax enough to see what is important in life - each other. Thanks so much for everything! We will see you next year.
reviews.title: Perfect Rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Lassner Family
reviews.title: Amazing Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the spacious room and attention to detail. Staff was what you expect from a Four Seasons property - wonderful. The bathroom was enormous and the room was always attended to when we were gone. The adult pool had the best infinity view I have seen. The grounds were immaculate and the beach never too crowded. The hotel neighbors all had beautiful properties to tour... but I could have stayed at the Four Seasons the entire time and been happy. My only complaint was the renovation of the spa facilities. I love using the steam room after working out and that was completely closed. However, the workout room itself was better than most.
reviews.title: Perfection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: All the other reviews that praise this hotel are absolutely correct. It is no wonder why this property is regarded as one of the best resorts in the world. They really just make every aspect great and totally envelope you in a true resort experience. You really feel like you are on vacation if you stay here. Grounds, rooms, and everything are all perfect. Restaurants are extremely expensive, but that was expected.
reviews.title: Good 4S on Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked at the Grand Wailea (GW) next door and after 1 night switched to this property. It honestly was night and day and our experience was amazing. The service at this hotel was over the top and the staff anticipated our every need. In the mornings we would go on a long walk and when we would arrive back to the front of the hotel the bellman would greet us with a cold towel and water. While at the adult pool (which is incredible) they staff would come around hourly with fresh lemonade, fruit, aloe vera and ice water. Most people think this is fluff and your paying extra for all of this but our room rate at the 4Seasonas was $85 less per night than at the GWailea.
reviews.title: The FOUR SEASONS was 5 STAR!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The size and accessibility of the property was great and super manageable and you could get around this property very quickly and easily. The rooms were awesome and the beds were impossible to get out of in the morning and included a "turn down" service with fresh towels, slippers and little treats every night. We ended up eating at all of the restaurants and nothing but good things to say.
reviews.title: Not as perfect as everyone says.
Lovely, from start to finish.
reviews.text: When planning my trip I bounced back and forth from the 4Seasons to the GW and ended up picking the wrong hotel. I wish I would have know what I know now prior to booking. Luckily we were able to get out of our GW reservation without a penalty and ended up extending our trip from 8 days to 12 days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negatives I could find about this property would be for breakfast you really had only 1 option and it was kind of pricey and the chairs at the adult pool would be booked by the early am. What we did was put our name on the list for chairs and head to the beach and the staff would call our cell phone when our spot opened up.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay! Beautiful Resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would recommend this property to anyone that wants to be treated like royalty. The hotel is child friendly but if you have a large family and want to keep the kids busy I would also check out the GW. Hope this helps.
reviews.title: Relaxation and activities can be had at the luxurious Four Seasons Maui at Wailea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a week here and we cannot wait to go back. Everything was beautiful and the service was fantastic. If you can treat yourself to this place don't hesitate to do so!
reviews.title: Most incredible hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I have traveled to the Four Seasons Maui for years. Our last visit was our first with our infant daughter and we couldn't be more pleased. We were upgraded to an ocean view prime suite and it was simply amazing! Every detail was tended to for our daughter. The room was completely child proofed before we arrived - every plug covered and the lanai banister had netting. There were welcome amenities for her and a snack on arrival. Laundry was an exceptional value for children and food free in most restaurants for kids under 5. As always, the spa was amazing and pool was fantastic. We got married at the resort a few years back and didn't think anything could top that trip. We were wrong...the resort keeps getting better and better!
reviews.title: Four Season Wailea Keeps Get Better & Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 6 incredible days at the Four Seasons Maui. Having stayed at many of the best resorts in Hawaii, I can't think of another that I enjoyed more than the Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Incredible Resort...Deserving of All the Praise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - Perfect for us. Wailea is less touristy than Kaanapali/Lahaina, less windy than Kapalua, and typically warmer than either. We enjoyed the convenience of having the Shops at Wailea nearby and other dining options there and at the Grand Wailea & Kea Lani, but always appreciated returning back to the tranquility of the FS.
reviews.title: Every Day is a Day in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - Large, nicely decorated, all of the amenities that we needed. I like that the small refrigerator was empty for us to put extra water and drinks in rather than being filled with expensive items we wouldn't have used. Excellent views, though as "Paul-Michael" pointed out below, our Prime Ocean View room didn't face directly toward the ocean but rather at an angle.
reviews.title: A very safe choice for global nomads and discerning travelers everywhere...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Environs, service, facilities, rooms, restaurants and entertainment were all impeccable. Staff were absolutely accommodating in every way. The pools, the beach, the free outrigger canoe session, the evening entertainment at the lobby bar, the stunning serenity pool, the beautiful garden and the top-notch dining were all contributed to the vacation of a lifetime. We could not get over how well we were taken care of. Although staying here is not cheap, the quality of the hotel left us entirely satisfied.
reviews.title: Best honeymoon hotel imaginable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just came back from a week at the Four Seasons Maui in one of the suites.
reviews.title: Exquisite! Will be back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the generic room decor was a bit disappointing for the price, the hotel more than made up for it with the exceptionally spacious bathroom, gracious staff, wonderful food, and excellent location.
reviews.title: Exceptional service, beautiful property... AWESOME place, a must stay in Maui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: On the room:
reviews.title: Absolute paradise- can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I think I can be forgiven for expecting more from the hotel room, given the gorgeous public areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxed decadence at its best

aka: Four Seasons Resort Maui At Wailea Hotel Wailea
